nav.div: Mason City Schools » Departments » Communication & Connection » News » Coronavirus Update

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(0, 138, 0);

font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

span.span: We are excited to share a new

span.style: font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: specifically dedicated to Mason City Schools’ COVID-19 response, resources, and updates.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

p.span: On Monday, April 20, 2020, Governor DeWine extended the closure of all schools through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. While our school buildings are closed, our staff are working hard to ensure students are supported and learning continues. Your family's well being is at the forefront of our mind. We know hearing the official word that school isn’t reopening this school year is difficult for a lot of us. We are grappling with the loss of special moments, and normalcy. Please reach out if you need help. Because while we may not be physically together, we are still here for you.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: Watch

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: of Superintendent Jonathan Cooper sharing our district’s response to Governor DeWine’s closure order, and addressing a gathering by some members of the MHS Class of 2020.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt; border: none; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: 266px; height: 228px;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

p.span: Below are responses to common questions from our families and the public.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: Why are you no longer reporting if there are confirmed cases of COVID-19 in the Mason City Schools community?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

br.span: In our early communications, we were following the same public health guidelines that we do for communicable diseases. School buildings have now been closed long past the 14 days of transmission, so our students are no longer at risk of contracting the virus from a classmate or staff member while at school. In addition, in order to protect people's privacy, our public health and state education partners have now advised us to not share information specific to our school district. The state of Ohio does share the numbers of confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Ohio, as well as the number of confirmed cases by county. As of today, there are 116 confirmed cases in Warren County. You can regularly check this information for updates on the

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;
font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: Some MHS seniors went to the high school parking lot last night and didn’t practice social distancing. What is the district doing?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

br.span: Last night, Mason City Schools joined school districts around the country in

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

br.span: , and asked the community to turn on porch lights to honor the Class of 2020 at 8:20pm. We appreciate that many students remained home. However, we learned a lesson after seeing pictures and videos that showed some seniors gathering without physical distancing. As soon as reports came in, police were notified and responded. Our students were very respectful to law enforcement officers, and several apologized. We recognize that our students are craving connection. There is no doubt that social distancing is hard for many of our teens and children. We also now better understand how even events that are intended to honor students from afar could unintentionally tempt them to violate the state’s orders that protect Ohioans. We will apply lessons from this situation as we consider other ways to honor students. We ask for your support in helping our children and teens socialize safely.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

br.span: Now that we know we won’t be coming back to school in May, can we pick up items left in classrooms and the buildings?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

br.span: If your child is in need of items required for remote learning, please email your child’s principal and he or she will work with you to have the item delivered to you, or come up with a safe way for you to pick it up.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

br.span: Next week, we will announce plans for families to retrieve remaining items that have been left at school. In order to maintain social distancing requirements, families will be asked to remain in cars, and your child’s items will be placed in your vehicle’s trunk.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: I love seeing the Comet Connector bus going through town. How can I sign up my child, and does it have to be for a birthday?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(32, 33, 36); font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

br.span: During this time when buildings are closed, we know that some Comets are missing seeing their bus drivers and riding the bus. Also we have Comets marking special birthday milestones without their friends or extended family. To help make our Comets days a little more special during this time of social distancing, our Mason City Schools Transportation Department will be glad to pay your Comet a special visit with the Comet Connector Bus! This does not have to be for a birthday - you can sign up just to celebrate YOUR Comet!

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 11pt;

span.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 205); font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

a.span: Request the Comet Connector Bus come to your home.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: How can we support our commUNITY?

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

br.span: #CometCarryout

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

br.span: : This is a very crucial time for our local businesses, especially those in hospitality. Consider supporting our local businesses

span.style: text-decoration-line: underline; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: Participate in the Chamber’s MADE to Eat Takeout Blitz and see how many local restaurants you can support. In addition,

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: and choose

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: “Comet Carryout”

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: and you can bless a family in need with a meal from one of our local businesses.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(0, 138, 0);

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Ohioans have been following the directives of public health officials and staying home - which is flattening the curve. Staying home is saving lives, but it is also hurting our economy. We recognize that remote learning and closing schools are necessary, but they aren’t a long-term strategy. Mason City Schools buildings will most likely not reopen in May. But when we DO reopen, we will be ready to do so safely.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: Watch

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: of Superintendent Jonathan Cooper sharing that we miss you, how we will keep students and staff safe when the day comes that our buildings reopen, and ways we hope to honor the Class of 2020.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; border: none; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: 233px; height: 213px; font-family: verdana;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Below are responses to common questions from our families and the public.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: Will the Class of 2020 still get to have graduation?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Everything we are hearing about large group gatherings helps us recognize that this year’s graduation ceremony for the 880 members of the Class of 2020 will look very different from past graduations that were held at Xavier University’s Cintas Center. Our High School administration is developing a plan and location based on our seniors and Class of 2020 families’ feedback that will be safe and special.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: I have new neighbors. How do they register for school with the buildings closed?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Due to the coronavirus pandemic, our registration procedures have changed. The Central Registration Office is currently closed for all in-person appointments. We are continuing to enroll students for the 2019-2020 school year, and incoming kindergartners for 2020-2021. Families should

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: and email them to

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: or mail to

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: Mason Central Office

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Attention: Registration

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: 211 N. East Street

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Mason, OH 45040

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Is the meal program only for families on free and reduced lunch?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

br.span: We want to help any family who needs it! Families do not need to qualify for free and reduced lunch to pick up breakfasts and lunches. Pick up two breakfasts and two lunches on Mondays, and three breakfasts and three lunches on Wednesdays. Children do not need to be present in the car to receive free meals.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: How can we support our commUNITY?

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Local Businesses - Pay It Forward

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: : This is a very crucial time for our local businesses. The MADE CDC (Mason Deerfield Chamber Community Development Corporation, a Non-For-Profit Organization) has launched

p.span: Are you still taking attendance? How should we notify the school if our child is sick or unable to complete remote learning assignments?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: During this time apart, our focus remains on student learning and ensuring our students’ well being. Even under these challenging circumstances, 99 percent of MCS students engaged with their remote learning assignments last week. We want to provide support, guidance, and structure, while still providing enough flexibility to accommodate the realities of the situation many of us are navigating. If your child or family is ill or unable to complete remote learning assignments, please email your child’s teacher(s) and your school’s attendance administrative assistant:

br.span: Mason City Schools has areas on our school campuses where you can access free WIFI. External access points are available at ME/MI (side parking lot closest to church), MHS (front parking lot on side of Z pod, close to attendance door), and the MECC Access Point will be located at the front of the building on Thursday.

br.span: I got my ballot in the mail, but am unsure what I’m supposed to say for the election type, and the date when filling it out.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: The Ohio General Assembly has put in a plan in place that will allow all Ohioans to continue voting by mail until April 28. When you receive your ballot after requesting it from the Board of Elections, the “Election type” is Primary, and you can choose Issues only, Political party (Issues only and Political party ballots all have Mason City Schools Issue 12 on them), and it is fine to have March 17 or April 28 as the “Election date.”

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Your ballot must be postmarked by 4/27 or hand-delivered to the Board of Elections dropbox by 7:30pm on April 28th, 520 Justice Dr., Lebanon, OH 45036.

Despite this COVID-19 pandemic and so many neighbors dealing with power outages yesterday, we are proud of all that our students, staff, families and community are doing to care for each other, establish routines, and learn. span.span: of Superintendent Jonathan Cooper sharing his appreciation for how Comet Culture values shape our actions and decisions.

span.style: border: none; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: 332px; height: 304px;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: We’ve started the phase of remote learning where students are learning new material, and assignments are graded. How are you taking into account all the unique situations and circumstances of this time?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: MCS is committed to living out our Culture Guide through this time and to reflect a Comet Cares approach to teaching and learning. Our Comet Cares approach will allow us to be compassionate, responsive, and equitable to our students’ and families’ unique situations and circumstances. Students and their families are having a wide range of experiences during this worldwide crisis. Recognizing the challenges they may be facing, and that they are out of their control, our grading policies must do no harm to any child. During this time of remote learning, our focus is first and foremost on student learning and ensuring our students’ well being.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Graded RLE learning assignments/activities during remote learning can only maintain or raise a K-5 student’s final standards-based score or a 6-12 student’s final semester grade.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: In grades 6-12, students who do not engage in Remote Learning Experiences, or who do not show basic levels of understanding, will receive an “Incomplete.” Our school teams will make every effort to support each student. If students are unable to engage in remote learning even with those supports from the school team, the school team will collaborate with students and/or family to determine future steps for the student’s learning.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

a.span: Learn more about our approach to grading

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: on the MCScovid19.com website.

br.span: My child is having conflicts with the teachers’ Office Hours. What should we do?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

p.span: We have tried to schedule office hours to avoid conflicts as much as we can. If you are having a consistent conflict, please reach out to your child’s teachers or principal.

br.span: Personal Care Items for Seniors

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: : The Council on Aging has partnered with FilltheTruck.org to collect items to be distributed to seniors in our region in need. Seniors will be given a four-pack of toilet paper and household and personal items to help them through the crisis. Consider adding a friendly note or having your child(ren) color a picture that can be included in the boxes they deliver to seniors. Donations will be accepted through April 30, 2020.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Needed items include: Toilet Paper (4pk, preferred - no single, unwrapped rolls), Hand Sanitizer, Bar Soap, Liquid Soap, Antibacterial Wipes, Denture Care Items, Toothpaste, Lysol Spray, Dish Detergent, Laundry Detergent, Tissues, Cat and Dog Food.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Drop off items at Lakota Hills Baptist Church, 6300 Tylersville Rd., West Chester, OH 45069 on

p.span: As of today at 2pm, there are no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Mason City Schools, and 5,148 confirmed cases in Ohio. Below are responses to common questions from our families and the public.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Now that we know we won’t be back in school until at least May, what is Mason’s plan to let students pick up items from their lockers?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: During the weeks of April 13 and April 20, Mason High School, Mason Middle School and Mason Intermediate School will have opportunities for families to retrieve items that have been left in lockers that are needed for remote learning experiences. In order to maintain social distancing requirements, families will be asked to remain in cars, and your child’s items will be placed in your vehicle’s trunk. MHS Principal Bobby Dodd, MMS Principal Lauren Gentene and MI Principal Eric Messer will share your school’s specific plans by Friday.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: We understand that some of our MECC and Mason Elementary School students may have left items in their classrooms, or in other parts of the building. At this time, we are not able to reunite students with items from their classes. We will continue to work with our public health partners, and will let you know when we have determined a plan that allows for a more wide-spread pick up of items.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: As of today at 2pm, there are no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Mason City Schools, and 4,450 confirmed cases in Ohio. Below are responses to common questions from our families and the public.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: I’ve read some concerning things about some of the online platforms like Zoom. How is Mason protecting students while they are online?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Mason City Schools takes the safety and privacy of our staff and students seriously. Lately, numerous Zoom meetings have been hijacked by inappropriate content. We've chosen not to use Zoom with our students. Teachers may offer opportunities to connect via live video call (for example, through Google Meet) but they will not be required. Teachers may also use asynchronous video-based technologies, such as FlipGrid and SeeSaw, to communicate with students. Our staff and students use Google on a daily basis, and during this period of time we're leaning heavily on frequently used tools and software versus adding new tools. We know there's no perfect tool for video conferencing, and as adults we have strong preferences.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: How can parents keep children safe online?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: Our Innovative Systems Department has developed an

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: for keeping your child safe online. The course includes strategies for keeping your child safe while they’re connected to the internet, sharing available hardware options to set time limits and prevent specific sites, and offering software options to protect your child.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: I thought we were off school on Friday for a Personal Learning Day. What’s happening now?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Because we have had quite a bit of disruption and about a week of Personal Learning Days before and after Spring Break while we transitioned to Remote Learning, we determined it would be best for staff and families to not have another day of students missing some of their newly established routines. That being said, our Remote Learning Experience plan is asynchronous learning, and does not require students to complete given assignments on a specific day or time. If your family requires more flexibility, please reach out to your child’s teacher(s).

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: and choose “Comet Carryout” and you can bless a family in need with a meal from one of our local businesses.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Making Masks for MCS Workers:

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: The CDC is now advising Americans to voluntarily wear a basic cloth or fabric face mask when they go out to help curb the spread of the new coronavirus. If you are a crafty person and willing to help make cloth masks for Mason City Schools workers, we would love to take them!

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

a.span: Learn how to make masks here.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(0, 138, 0);

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(254, 254, 254); font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: We appreciate your patience and perspective as we settle into our Remote Learning reality. If you haven’t explored our dedicated

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(254, 254, 254); font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(254, 254, 254); font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: , we encourage you to do so.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: Watch

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: of Superintendent Jonathan Cooper sharing ways our Comet CommUNITY is coming together!

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; border: none; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: 372px; height: 286px; font-family: verdana;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: As of yesterday at 2pm, there are no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Mason City Schools, and 2,902 confirmed cases in Ohio. Below are responses to common questions from our families and the public.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: What types of learning assignments should I expect as we enter the next phase of Remote Learning on Monday?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: The majority of our learning will be asynchronous so that students can engage at a time that is convenient to the family’s schedule.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: If your child is in grades PK-6:

ul.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

li.span: Teachers will include learning from all content areas. Learning plans will include a mix of introducing new content and allowing students time to practice and reinforce what has been introduced.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

li.span: Students will not need to be in front of a device for all of their learning time. Learning plans will include a combination of experiences that require technology and do not require technology. Students will spend time reading, writing, or solving math problems away from a screen.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

li.span: Special area teachers (such as gym, music, and art) will each share one lesson a week for students to engage in.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: If your child is in grades 7-12:

ul.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

li.span: Students will receive weekly learning plans from their teachers for all of the courses they are currently enrolled in at MMS or MHS. The weekly learning plans will be organized so that students can engage with learning in a manner that best fits their schedule and learning preferences. Some students may prefer to engage with each course daily and some may prefer to focus on 1-2 courses per day.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

li.span: Learning plans will utilize a variety of different methods to engage students in learning new content and skills. Learning plans will include a combination of experiences that require technology and do not require technology.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

li.span: Learning plans will primarily ask students to utilize tools and resources they are familiar with and have used throughout this year. If a student needs additional support or guidance with any aspect of a learning plan, they are strongly encouraged to take advantage of the Comet Connect Time (see below) and/or email their teacher.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: If your student receives core academic instruction in a specialized classroom

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

ul.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

li.span: Your intervention specialist will be in touch with you to develop individual plans for lesson delivery.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: How long will my child be expected to spend focused on learning activities each day?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Understanding that many families are juggling multiple responsibilities at home and that during a regular school day students have some non-learning time (for example, at lunch, transitioning between classes, or recess), our expectation is that students will spend less than a full school day actively engaging in learning activities. Exactly how long students spend engaged in learning activities will vary depending on their learning pace.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: If you find that your student is overwhelmed and learning activities are taking too long or that your student is ready for extended learning activities, please reach out to your teacher.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: How do I get refunds for activities, events or trips that have now been cancelled?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: We are issuing refunds for activities and field trips that were scheduled in April but have now been cancelled. If you have questions about an activity or trip, please reach out to your school principal.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: What is Mason’s ongoing plan to support families facing food insecurity?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Mason City Schools Child Nutrition Department serves meals on Mondays and Wednesdays from 11:30AM-1:00 PM at Mason Intermediate School, 6307 Mason-Montgomery Road, and 11:30AM-12:30PM at St. Vincent DePaul, 1065 Reading Rd, and Western Row Elementary, 755 Western Row Road.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Please remain in your cars and meals will be distributed in a "drive-up" manner. Student name and/or ID will be needed and you will be provided a display tag for your car to record that information. To limit contact, meals will be placed in the trunk of each vehicle.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: If you are having a hard time getting to the pick up location, please call 513-336-6526 option 3 or email Molly Schmidt at

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: We are so grateful for our community partners - Comet Cupboard and Joshua’s Place who are providing additional food and personal care items to families in need. Families may pick up meal kits at Mason Intermediate on Mondays and Wednesdays from 11:30AM-1:00PM and Christ’s Church of Mason, 5165 Western Row Rd, from 5:00pm-7:00pm on Monday evenings.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: We encourage you to support #CometCarryout if you are able to do so. Simply

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: and choose “Comet Carryout” to bless a family in need with a meal from one of our local businesses.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 11pt; border: none; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: 624px; height: 351px; font-family: arial;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Can I still vote in the Primary Election?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Last week, the Ohio General Assembly approved a plan that allows all Ohioans to continue voting by mail until April 28. Don’t lose your vote and voice!

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: Any registered voter who has not already cast a ballot in the Primary Election can request an application to vote by mail by calling the Warren County Board of Elections at 513-695-1358. Voters can also vote by mail by downloading, filling out, printing, signing, and mailing

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: to their county Board of Elections.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(26, 31, 45);

span.span: Your completed ballot must be

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: postmarked

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(26, 31, 45);

span.span: by Monday, April 27

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(26, 31, 45);

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(26, 31, 45);

span.span: When you receive your ballot by mail from the Board of Elections, it will include prepaid return postage. Your completed ballot can also be delivered to the Warren County Board of Elections (520 Justice Drive, Lebanon, OH 45036) and placed in the available receptacle located outside the office no later than

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(26, 31, 45);

span.span: 7:30pm on April 28

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(26, 31, 45);

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 11pt 0pt 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: How can we support our commUNITY?

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Shop for Senior Citizens:

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: The Coronavirus crisis is affecting almost everyone’s routines, transportation, and way of life. This means that the usual social support and contacts older adults have with others may be diminished. For homebound seniors without support networks, this can be devastating. For some, the ability to even get to the grocery store for basic food items has been completely disrupted. In response, United Way of Warren County Volunteer Resource Center in partnership with Warren County Community Services, Inc. is recruiting volunteers willing to shop for 60 identified low-income and at-risk senior citizens in our community for the most basic and sustainable items.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 11pt 0pt 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: Unite with Light for Healthcare Professionals:

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: On Sunday, April 5th at 8PM, place a luminary or a simple candle outside your home as we unite with light. Let this offer support to the many doctors, nurses and medical professionals working to aid others through the COVID-19 outbreak. Let this allow our community to shine bright despite the circumstances!

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: We appreciate all that you are juggling. Give yourself grace and have a good weekend!

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(0, 138, 0);

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(254, 254, 254); font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: Our district’s goal for Mason’s Remote Learning Experience (RLE) is to provide a high-quality, engaging learning experience for our students that is also manageable for families who may be juggling multiple responsibilities during this unprecedented time.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(254, 254, 254); font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: When designing our RLE, our Learning Experience Team drew on resources and insights from a range of experts, while also learning from the experiences of districts in other states who started remote learning before us. Our approach to RLE is based on the strong relationships that have been built throughout the year among teachers and students. We have tried to rely on technologies that students are already familiar with; however, RLE may require some new tools and our teachers will do their best to offer students needed supports.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(254, 254, 254); font-size: 10pt; border: none; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: 386px; min-height: 247px; font-family: verdana; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: of Superintendent Jonathan Cooper and his daughter share more about what’s coming up with Remote Learning.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: As of yesterday at 2pm, there are no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Mason City Schools, and 2,199 confirmed cases in Ohio. Below are responses to common questions from our families and the public.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: When and how will my child begin to receive remote learning assignments?

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: This week, MCS learners will engage in Remote Learning Experience (RLE) Orientation assignments on Thursday and Friday. Assignments will be shared the evening prior to allow families time to plan (for example, if they are taking children to a caregiver).

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: If your student is in grades PK-4:

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: Orientation assignments will be emailed to you at 8pm tonight, Wednesday, April 1.

span.style: font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: If your child is in grades 5-12

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: : Orientation assignments will be posted to Schoology by 8pm tonight, Wednesday, April 1.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: Note:

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: If your child receives core academic instruction in a specialized classroom from an intervention specialist, the intervention specialist will contact you directly to develop individual plans for lesson delivery.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: What actions do I or my student need to take now?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: It is important that students engage in the RLE Orientation assignments on Thursday so that we know that students are able to access remote learning activities. Orientation assignments are designed to test our systems and allow time to troubleshoot if students have trouble accessing them.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-left: 40px;

span.style: font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;
font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: For PK-4 students,

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: please read through the teacher’s email and make sure to respond to the activity that the teacher shares.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-left: 40px;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-left: 40px;

span.style: font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;
font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: For grades 5-12 students,

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: students should log into Schoology and open and review the Remote Learning folder

span.style: text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: for each course in which they are enrolled

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt;
vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt;

span.span: We also encourage you and your student to engage in the digital citizenship learning activities that are shared this week. For grades PK-6, they will be part of teachers’ RLE Orientation assignments. Students in grades 7-12 will have a “Netiquette” resource posted as a building update in Schoology.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: What should I do if I do not receive the RLE Orientation assignment tonight?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: If you or your student has not received the RLE Orientation assignment by 8:30pm on Wednesday, April 1, please complete

span.style: text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: . We will actively monitor the form throughout the day on Thursday and Friday so that we can troubleshoot and offer support as needed.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: What will remote learning look like next week?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Beginning Monday, April 6, teachers will begin to introduce new content through remote learning. Students will access remote learning activities the same way that Orientation assignments are shared.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: If your student is in grades PK-4:

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: You will receive an email by 8pm each evening detailing the learning for the following day and including any relevant links or resources. Teachers have been given the option of previewing all learning activities for the week on Monday, or sharing learning assignments on a day-to-day basis. Regardless of which method the teacher has chosen, you will receive an email each day at 8pm.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: If your student is in grades 5-12

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: : Remote learning activities will be posted in Schoology course pages. A weekly learning plan will be posted by 8pm each Sunday to allow students and families to plan for the upcoming week. Students will access learning plans for each course that they are currently enrolled in. Learning plans will be in a folder located at the top of each course materials page.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Where can I get more information about what to expect with Remote Learning?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: Check out the

span.style: text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: on our MCS COVID-19 Site for additional information about our Remote Learning Experience, including what types of learning activities to expect, how much time students will be expected to spend on remote learning assignments, how to get support, and step you can take to support your student.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Now that we know we won’t be back to school until at least May 1st, can I pick up some of my child’s things?

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.span: Since we now know that buildings will be closed through at least May 1, we are working on a plan to allow students to come back into schools and pick up items in an orderly way that still allows for social distancing. We hope to have something in place for next week.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 11pt 0pt 0pt;

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: How can we support our commUNITY?

span.style: font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: #CometCarryout

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: : This is a very crucial time for our local businesses, especially those in hospitality. Consider supporting our local businesses

span.style: text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 31pt;

vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: Participate in the Chamber’s MADE to Eat Takeout Blitz and see how many local restaurants you can support. In addition,

span.style: text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;
vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

span.span: and choose “Comet Carryout” and you can bless a family in need with a meal from one of our local businesses.

span.style: font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Complete the 2020 Census:

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

br.span: Local communities depend on information from the Census Bureau to fund programs that promote the well-being of families and children, as well as equal employment opportunities for you and your neighbors. If you have not already responded, please complete your United States Census Questionnaire at

vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 10pt; font-family: verdana;

background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
font-size: 10pt; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(254, 254, 254); font-family: verdana; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: Many of us are working to make sense of our new normal. As you discover (or re-discover!) ways to establish routines and connections, please consider sharing pictures or videos with us on Facebook and Twitter. We know our students are missing their teachers and classmates, and we love seeing you all!

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
