br.span: 3/11/2020 Update

span.style: white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: This is certainly an E+R=O moment.

span.style: font-size: 13px;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: We would like to acknowledge all of the thoughtful questions and concerns that have been sent to us as we

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: Respond

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: to the COVID-19

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: Event

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: in a way that ensures the best possible

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: Outcome

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: . The feedback gives our leadership team the opportunity to discuss family questions and concerns with our public health partners during daily conversations. Thank you for your patience as we navigate an evolving situation.

span.strong: There are no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Mason City Schools, and 4 confirmed cases in Ohio.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Today, Governor Mike DeWine announced that the state is not recommending the closure of K-12 schools at this time.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: “I’m not ordering to close schools. We may get to that point, but not today,” Gov. DeWine said.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

br.span: How is Mason City Schools making decisions?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

br.span: Ohio schools continue to follow the directives of the state health department. The Warren County Health District is the lead agency in our community’s COVID-19 response, and our schools play an important role in providing stability and safety for our region. Superintendent Jonathan Cooper works in daily partnership with the Warren County Health District, and officials from the City of Mason, Warren County, Greater Cincinnati, and other superintendents from across the state and country to assess and respond to new information. This is a dynamic situation, and we will continue to adjust and adapt.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 11pt;

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: Are we still holding indoor events at Mason City Schools?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

br.span: As of today, March 11, in response to Governor DeWine’s emergency order and the Ohio Department of Health recommendations to limit social contact, all after-school indoor events that include guests/spectators have been cancelled until after Spring Break. We will evaluate opportunities to reschedule concerts, musicals, etc.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 11pt;

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: When would a school close?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

br.span: Mason City Schools continues to follow the recommendations of the Warren County Health District, the State of Ohio, and area educational professionals. The current recommendation is not to proactively close schools or the district. Families need to prepare for the possibility that schools could be closed as the outbreak continues.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 11pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: If your child’s school is closed, you will receive a phone call, email, and text the night prior to closure, or with as much advance notice as possible.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 11pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Additionally, a school may be closed if staff absences impact school operations and learning. School may also be closed because the cleaning needs across the district surpass the availability of custodial services. In these cases, the district or school will communicate directly with families and the school community.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: One additional

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(254, 254, 254); color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: consideration health responders have asked us to consider is the impact that closing schools has on our health care community. Cincinnati is fortunate to have great medical institutions and providers. Many of our students’ families are health care providers or work in the healthcare industry. If schools close, fewer people will be able to provide front-line support. As soon as our public health partners determine schools should proactively close, we will.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 11pt 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: If schools close, what is our plan for educating students?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

br.span: We have plans in place to continue the educational mission; however, the health of our staff and students is what’s most important. If someone is symptomatic or has contracted the disease, their focus should be on getting better.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: In the event

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: of a school closure, our desired outcome

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: is that students continue to have access to relevant, meaningful learning opportunities usi

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: ng our existing systems for sharing information electronically.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 11pt 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Additionally, if a student needs to self-quarantine, teachers will work with that student to make sure that they do not fall behind. Of course, if a student is ill we want that student to focus on getting better!

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 11pt;

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: What about athletics & club outdoor games at Mason City Schools?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(44, 37, 31);

br.span: We are following the OHSAA and Governor DeWine’s recommendations to severely limit spectators to reduce the spread of COVID-19. Each athlete or contestant is allowed four visitors to games or contests until further guidance.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: What about school-sponsored travel?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

br.span: At this time, all school-sponsored travel and field trips have been cancelled.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 11pt 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: What about spring break travel?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: If you will be traveling during spring break, please monitor the CDC travel advisories. Currently, travelers to Italy, Iran, China, and South Korea must self-quarantine for 14 days when arriving back in the United States.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: The CDC now recommends that travelers, particularly those with underlying health issues, defer all cruise ship travel. Governor DeWine shares that each traveler should ask themselves “Is it necessary?” Please visit the

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: for more information about travel.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 11pt;

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: Can I keep my child home?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

br.span: Families know what’s best for their children and we will honor your decision to keep your child home from school during this time. Absences will be excused. Please contact 1-855-339-9012 and select the option for “Preventative COVID-19,” if you will be keeping your child home.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 11pt;

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: How are schools and buses being cleaned and disinfected?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

br.span: All schools are cleaned and disinfected regularly with hospital-grade disinfectants as a standard practice in the district. Buildings are now being cleaned and disinfected more often, and frequently touched surfaces such as door handles, desks, water fountains, technology, etc. are cleaned daily. Custodians will replace soap and hand sanitizers often, and hand sanitizing stations are in shared spaces. All buses are being disinfected daily, and the Child Nutrition Department will continue to follow food safety practices and use approved disinfectants.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

br.span: How do I talk to my child about COVID-19?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: As public conversations around COVID-19 increase, children may worry about themselves, their family, and friends getting ill. Parents, family members, school staff, and other trusted adults can play an important role in helping children make sense of what they hear in a way that is honest, accurate, and minimizes anxiety or fear. The CDC has created

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: to help adults have conversations with children about COVID-19, and ways children can avoid getting and spreading the disease.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: How are schools helping students prevent COVID-19?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: We are providing resources, supplies and additional time for students to wash their hands regularly.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: Please help us by keeping sick children home.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

br.span: Anyone that has symptoms of any illness should stay home 24 hours without fever and without medication. If students exhibit illness or COVID-19 related symptoms we will isolate them, and contact a parent or guardian to come pick them up immediately.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: What can staff and students do to stay healthy?

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: Please take the

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: that are recommended by the CDC,

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: such as hand washing, covering a cough or sneeze with a tissue, and staying home when you are sick.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Again, we appreciate your partnership and patience, and will continue to provide regular updates as this rapidly changing situation evolves.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
color: rgb(0, 138, 0);

span.br: As questions arise about the potential spread of coronavirus in the United States, we want to continue sharing information with our families and staff about how Mason City Schools are Responding to this potential Event so that we have the best possible Outcome. There are no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Mason City Schools, and 3 confirmed cases in Ohio.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Since the beginning of the outbreak, the Mason City School District has been collaborating with our public health partners. Our school district has an infectious disease preparedness plan, and we work in coordination with the Warren County Health District to ensure that all of our Comets have a safe and healthy learning environment.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
span.br: It is important to know that during a major outbreak, we would follow the health department’s lead on any quarantines, closures, or other health measures needed. Our primary focus is the safety of students and staff. At the same time, we place a high value on providing high quality learning experiences. Based on our experience from our Personal Learning Days over the last three years, we have a plan for delivering remote learning opportunities

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
span.br: We have received a number of questions regarding students or families who have recently traveled internationally. As you may know, protocols have been put in place to evaluate and, in some cases, quarantine passengers as they return to the United States from Level 3 countries (China, Italy, Iran and South Korea.) The CDC now recommends that travelers, particularly those with underlying health issues, defer all cruise ship travel. Our public health partners are not recommending additional actions by school districts at this time. Please visit the CDC’s website for more information about travel.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
span.br: As always, we encourage anyone who is feeling ill to stay home! Just like the flu or common cold, if your child is exhibiting symptoms of fever or cough, they should remain home until they are fever and cough free for 24 hours without medication.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Keeping children home when they are sick is critical to prevention. Here are the two most effective preventative methods that we would appreciate your help in reinforcing with your child:

ul.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Hand-washing: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the bathroom; before eating; and after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing. If soap and water are not readily available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol.

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Cough and Sneezing: Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue and dispose of the tissue or cough/sneeze into your upper sleeve

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
span.br: In some parts of the country we have seen disrespectful and hateful words and actions directed toward members of our Asian community related to coronavirus. We stand with students, staff, and community members from all affected areas, of all races and ethnicities. As always, any student, staff, or school community member who experiences discrimination in our schools is encouraged to contact their school administration immediately.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: We will continue to share information with our community as we receive updates from our public health partners.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
span.br: The most vulnerable populations are adults over the age of 60, pregnant women, and persons with compromised immune systems.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: If you have questions regarding Coronavirus/COVID-19 please call the Ohio Department of Health’s new call center: 1-833-4ASKODH (1-833-427-5634). The call center is open 7 days a week from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. The call center staff includes licensed nurses and infectious disease experts. They are available to answer questions and provide accurate information about COVID-19, the risk to the public, and the state’s response. Visit the Ohio Department’s of Health’s website for more

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
font-size: 13px; color: rgb(0, 138, 0);
font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
font-size: 13px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana;

span.span: The health, safety and well-being of our Mason City Schools students and staff are a top priority. Our school district continues to follow the guidance of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the Warren County Health Department in our response to coronavirus.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana;

span.span: There are no confirmed cases of coronavirus disease 2019 in Mason City Schools or Ohio.

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: recommends precautions used for reducing the risk of infection for other illnesses, such as flu:

span.style: background-color: transparent; white-space: pre;
background-color: transparent; white-space: pre;

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-family: Verdana; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

span.style: font-size: 13px;

li.span: Wash your hands for 20 seconds or more with soapy water. If unavailable, use hand sanitizer.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-family: Verdana; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

span.style: font-size: 13px;

li.span: Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-family: Verdana; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

span.style: font-size: 13px;

li.span: Avoid contact with people who are sick

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-family: Verdana; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

span.style: font-size: 13px;

li.span: Stay home while you are sick (except to visit a health care professional) and to avoid contact with others.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-family: Verdana; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

span.style: font-size: 13px;

li.span: Cover your mouth/nose with a tissue or sleeve when coughing or sneezing.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-family: Verdana; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

span.style: font-size: 13px;

li.span: Get adequate sleep and eat well-balanced meals to ensure a healthy immune system.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.style: line-height:1.38;background-color:#fefefe;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:7pt 0pt 11pt 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 13px;

background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: Hand washing

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

span.span: Hand washing with soap and water for at least 20 seconds is the most effective way to prevent illness. Our schools are reminding students to wash their hands anytime they have used the restroom, and prior to lunch. These are always good habits, and critical to the containment of disease. Custodial staff will keep soap fully stocked in bathrooms to support these efforts.

p.style: line-height:1.38;background-color:#fefefe;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 11pt 0pt;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: Staff will also reinforce good hygiene and remind students to not touch their face, nose, or mouth, sneeze into a tissue or elbow, and reduce physical hand contact (high fives, fist bumps, etc.).

p.style: line-height:1.38;background-color:#fefefe;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 11pt 0pt;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: How can families and partners help?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: If regular hand washing isn’t possible, the next best option is to use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer or sanitizer wipes, with at least 60% alcohol. Currently, the district has supplies for schools, but families and partners can help by providing:

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

span.style: font-size: 13px;

li.span: Hand sanitizer or alcohol-based sanitizer wipes to school offices (at least 60% alcohol, dye free and fragrance-free)

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

span.style: font-size: 13px;

li.span: Tissues

p.style: line-height:1.38;background-color:#fefefe;margin-top:11pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 11pt 0pt;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: You can bring donations to your school’s main office.

p.style: line-height:1.38;background-color:#fefefe;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 11pt 0pt;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: School, Bus, and Common Area Cleaning

p.style: line-height:1.38;background-color:#fefefe;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 11pt 0pt;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: Custodial staff are increasing the frequency of cleaning common and high traffic areas each day. In a normal situation these areas would be cleaned once a day. Prioritized cleaning includes bathrooms, the lunchroom, common spaces, door handles, emergency bar on doors, etc. This means that ongoing maintenance will be deprioritized temporarily. Busses are also receiving additional cleaning. All efforts will be made to keep students healthy and safe.

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana;

span.span: More information on coronavirus disease 2019 can be found on the

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: FAQ’s

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: What is coronavirus exactly?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: It is a new, previously unidentified virus, according to the Center for Disease Control (CDC). Similar coronaviruses cause symptoms of a common cold or upper respiratory illness.

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: How does it spread?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: The exact method of contagion is not known at this time. It is known that it is spread from person to person from individuals experiencing fever and cough. Frequent hand washing is encouraged to limit exposure to this, as well as the flu virus.

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Should I send my child to school?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Just like the flu or common cold, if your child is exhibiting symptoms of fever or cough, they should remain home until they are fever and cough free for twenty four hours without medication.

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Should my child wear a mask?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: According to health professionals and the CDC, at this time it is not necessary to invest in surgical face masks and exam gloves. These items provide an illusion of safety when actually, without proper training, proper hand-washing and other preventive steps, the benefits are minimal.

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: Can we still travel, for example, over spring break?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: For the latest updates and advice on travel please refer to the CDC’s page.

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;

p.span: What happens to Election day if we have an outbreak?

span.style: font-family: Verdana; font-size: 13px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana;

span.span: We have not seen guidelines from the Secretary of State about the election, but encourage anyone who is able to consider

background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: at the Board of Elections,
